intro: Agelanthus djurensis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, attracting pollinators like birds and insects. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, while the stems are slender and covered in fine hairs. Agelanthus djurensis is adapted to arid environments and can thrive in well-drained soils.
